prompt: <description>**Part 1: A rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom** The first part of the CAD assembly is a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. Here are the detailed instructions to construct it: **Step 1: Creating the coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] **Step 2: Drawing the 2D sketch** Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face\_1) with the following loop (loop\_1): - line\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - line\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.1332] - line\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.1332], End Point [0.5091, 0.1744] - line\_4: Start Point [0.5091, 0.1744], End Point [0.3285, 0.355] - line\_5: Start Point [0.3285, 0.355], End Point [0.0, 0.355] - line\_6: Start Point [0.0, 0.355], End Point [0.0, 0.0] All loops are closed by default, and this loop consists of 6 lines. **Step 3: Scaling the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. **Step 4: Transforming the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by extruding it along the Z-axis with the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.75 - Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 The resulting part is a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The length and width are both 0.75 units, and the height is also 0.75 units. The final shape of the part is as described in the JSON. With these instructions, the junior CAD designer should be able to construct the first part of the CAD assembly accurately.</description>
